incidents.name: Branded Calling Issues on T-Mobile

incident_updates.body: Branded calling on T-Mobile for a small set of customers was  degraded between 12:00 AM on 09/25/2023 and 11:00 AM  on 02/12/2024 Pacific Time. During this period of time, customers that called T-Mobile handsets were unable to see their brand displayed for some calls. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Super SIM Over the Air Update Delays

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing Over-the-Air (OTA) update issue. This incident has been resolved.
We are now seeing recovery of the Over-the-Air (OTA) update issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 30 minutes.
We are now seeing recovery of the Over-the-Air (OTA) update issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 30 minutes.

We have identified a fix for the issue that is preventing some Super SIMs from successfully updating to their latest settings via over-the-air (OTA) updates. The fix needs to be implemented at one of our downstream partners, who expect to begin releasing the update to impacted SIMs as soon as possible. Afterwards, we expect to see fewer OTA updates failing to complete despite multiple attempts to contact the OTA service. Please note that it may take more than one attempt for a SIM to complete the OTA update procedure as there may be occasional failures or updates may need to be downloaded in multiple parts. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Afterwards, we expect to see fewer OTA updates failing to complete despite multiple attempts to contact the OTA service. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified a fix for the issue that is preventing some Super SIMs from successfully updating to their latest settings via over-the-air (OTA) updates. The fix needs to be implemented at one of our downstream partners, who expect to begin releasing the update to impacted SIMs around 4pm UTC tomorrow, February 7th. Afterwards, we expect to see fewer OTA updates failing to complete despite multiple attempts to contact the OTA service. Please note that it may take more than one attempt for a SIM to complete the OTA update procedure as there may be occasional failures or updates may need to be downloaded in multiple parts. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM Over the Air (OTA) update failures for some SIM cards. The issue is preventing Super SIMs from retrieving their latest OTA setting and optimizing connectivity for devices. We've identified a fix which will be going into testing as soon as possible. We will provide an update on Tuesday with the status of our fix.

We are experiencing Super SIM Over the Air (OTA) update failures for some SIM cards. The issue is preventing Super SIMs from retrieving their latest OTA setting and optimizing connectivity for devices. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected service provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

Customers will need to re-create the templates created during this time.

incidents.name: Double Encoded Numbers Issue for Lookup V1 API

incident_updates.body:
Twilio Lookup V1 API was degraded from 2024-01-11 19:41:59 UTC and 2024-01-15 16:42:08. About 0.13% of the traffic experienced anomalous responses. After investigating it was determined that the API was not performing an extra url-decoding step on top of the url-decoding performed in the downstream. This resulted in Lookups V1 not accepting 4.97% of the requests that were url-encoded multiple times. This incident affected 4.97% of the requests that included phone numbers that were url-encoded more than once and 0.13% of the total traffic.

The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Twilio SMS Delivery Failures to Multiple Countries

incident_updates.body:
Twilio SMS was degraded for 26 minutes from 6:31 a.m. PST to 6:57 a.m. PST on Feb. 5, 2024. During this period of time customers may have experienced outbound SMS delivery failures to the following countries and carriers:

United States
- Verizon over a subset of shortcodes

Indonesia
- Indosat Ooredoo for a subset of Twilio's Numbers and Registered Sender IDs
- H3G for a subset of Twilio's Numbers and Registered Sender IDs
- XL Axiata for a subset of Twilio's Numbers and Registered Sender IDs

Philippines
- Smart for a subset of Registered Sender IDs

Ireland
- IER for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- Tasco Mobile for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- H3G for a subset of Twilio's Numbers

Jamaica
- Digicel for a subset of Twilio's Numbers

Puerto Rico
- Liberty Mobile for a subset of Short Codes

Brazil
- Vivo for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- Claro for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- TIM for a subset of Twilio's Numbers

Haiti
- Digicel for a subset of Twilio's Numbers

Zimbabwe
- Net one for a subset of Twilio's Numbers and Registered Sender IDs

Germany
- T-Mobile for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- Vodafone for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- Telekom for a subset of Twilio's Numbers

Italy
- Wind Tre for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- Vodafone for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- COOP for a subset of Twilio's Numbers

Mexico
- Telcel for a subset of Twilio's Numbers
- Movistar for a subset of Twilio's Numbers

The issue has now been resolved.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Twilio SMS. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.
